metadata.Description: Small-scale, localized electrical grids that can operate independently or in conjunction with the main grid.

micro grids.Description: Micro grids address energy access challenges by providing electricity to remote and underserved areas.
Micro grids employ renewable energy sources to generate electricity in a decentralized manner.
Micro grids collaborate with local communities to ensure their energy needs are met sustainably and efficiently.
Micro grids support energy independence by reducing reliance on centralized power grids and promoting local energy generation.
Micro grids administer energy storage systems to ensure reliable and uninterrupted power supply.
Micro grids measure energy generation to optimize the utilization of renewable energy resources.
Micro grids align with decentralized energy systems to promote local energy generation and distribution.
Micro grids are an instance of distributed energy resources that enable localized energy generation and consumption.
